message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper is about improving neural machine translation (NMT) systems by optimizing them with a reward function based on semantic similarity. This topic falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP), which is typically classified under cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the use of machine learning techniques such as maximum likelihood estimation, which is a common approach in the field of machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper proposes a new reward function that is based on recent work in semantic similarity, which is a subfield of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The authors also evaluate their proposed method on four different languages, which involves working with text and potentially images, which could fall under the categories of computer vision (cs.CV) or neural networks (cs.NE).
